channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Takeaways from the latest Epstein files. And, police search for Savannah Guthrie's mom
item.description: NPR analyzes the latest Jeffrey Epstein files. And, Arizona authorities launched an urgent search for Savannah Guthrie's 84-year-old mother, Nancyafter a suspected home abduction.
item.content:encoded:
NPR analyzes the latest Jeffrey Epstein files. And, Arizona authorities launched an urgent search for Savannah Guthrie's 84-year-old mother, Nancyafter a suspected home abduction.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: 5 papers from the Super Bowl of Economics
item.description: Planet Money went to the annual meeting of the American Economics Association, and we saw some fascinating papers presented there.
item.content:encoded:
Planet Money went to the annual meeting of the American Economics Association, and we saw some fascinating papers presented there.

(Image credit: Nick Fountain)
item.dc:creator: Willa Rubin

item.title: I thought I'd heard my dad's voice for the last time. A movie helped me find it again
item.description: A period drama, a Supreme Court case and voice our film critic hadn't heard in decades.
item.content:encoded: A period drama, a Supreme Court case and voice our film critic hadn't heard in decades.
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello

item.title: 19 Winter Olympic storylines we're watching (they're not just about sports)
item.description: The Winter Olympics promise plenty of high adrenaline, fierce competition, historic firsts and emotional moments over 2 1/2 weeks. Here are some of the names and narratives to keep an eye on.
item.content:encoded: The Winter Olympics promise plenty of high adrenaline, fierce competition, historic firsts and emotional moments over 2 1/2 weeks. Here are some of the names and narratives to keep an eye on.
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: Kilmar Abrego Garcia becomes symbol of mistaken deportations
item.description: Immigration lawyers said Kilmar Abrego Garcia's landmark case highlights the pitfalls with the speed and scale of the Trump administration's goal of mass deportations.
item.content:encoded:
Immigration lawyers said Kilmar Abrego Garcia's landmark case highlights the pitfalls with the speed and scale of the Trump administration's goal of mass deportations.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Can't wait for Olympic curling? Trying its Southern cousin: skillet curling
item.description: It might seem inelegant to yeet an iron skillet across an ice rink. But this spinoff sport has its own techniques and lingo: You can throw a turtle at the bacon, for instance.
item.content:encoded:
It might seem inelegant to yeet an iron skillet across an ice rink. But this spinoff sport has its own techniques and lingo: You can throw a turtle at the bacon, for instance.

(Image credit: Aileen Perilla for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Here's why people say they're using 'Are You Dead?' and apps like it
item.description: Safety check-in apps — a way for loved ones to know that you're alive — have become more popular among adults who feel that modern life has made connection and community more difficult to maintain.
item.content:encoded:
Safety check-in apps — a way for loved ones to know that you're alive — have become more popular among adults who feel that modern life has made connection and community more difficult to maintain.

(Image credit: Felice Rosa)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Privatizing Fannie Mae is risky. Would it be a win for taxpayers or Trump's donors?
item.description: The idea has alarmed critics, who warn it could rattle financial markets and drive up mortgage rates, while potentially generating large profits for key Trump supporters.
item.content:encoded:
The idea has alarmed critics, who warn it could rattle financial markets and drive up mortgage rates, while potentially generating large profits for key Trump supporters.

(Image credit: J. David Ake)
item.dc:creator: Chris Arnold

item.title: Powerful people, random redactions: 4 things to know about the latest Epstein files
item.description: In the Justice Department's release of millions of pages of documents related to Jeffrey Epstein, there are several instances of unredacted names of Epstein's accusers, raising concerns about privacy.
item.content:encoded:
In the Justice Department's release of millions of pages of documents related to Jeffrey Epstein, there are several instances of unredacted names of Epstein's accusers, raising concerns about privacy.

(Image credit: Jon Elswick)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Energy Star has emerged stronger after Trump's EPA tried to end it
item.description: The Trump administration tried to end or privatize the government Energy Star efficiency program. But now Trump has signed a budget bill that fully funds the program and leaves it even stronger.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration tried to end or privatize the government Energy Star efficiency program. But now Trump has signed a budget bill that fully funds the program and leaves it even stronger.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Jeff Brady
